document.heading: Infant and Child Abandonment Prevention Amendment Act of 1990

history.narrative: Law 8-134, the “Infant and Child Abandonment Prevention Amendment Act of 1990,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 8-404, which was referred to the Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 13, 1990, and March 27, 1990, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on April 13, 1990, it was assigned Act No. 8-190 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
